Edited January 23, 2015 by spongey45
Just read the information from the user above

Wow, no one answered the question.

Simply put, wings are modular. You attach them together and typically you want to "clip" the grey areas of the wings into one another. Likewise control surfaces are going to clip over the wings grey area leaving only the front edge grey area visible. You can make them as large or small as you like. You do not need part clipping turned on to do this.

When you attach them, do it from the base of the plane outward in rows, then add struts in inconspicuous locations from front to back because parts can only attach in one spot.

If you want to download examples, click the second link in my signature. They won't fly in stock aerodynamics but they still show the construction techniques.

This picture is the B9 wings which work the same way (just without the grey) but I previously edited the picture to show the direction of wing construction.
